business.headline: ITR filing simplified: 5 updates you should knowUpdated tax rules, including pre-filled forms and flexible return filing, aim to reduce errors and ensure seamless compliance for taxpayers.

Explained: Why DAM Capital share price fell over 7% todayDAM Capital stock price: The sell-off is attributed to profit booking, a common trend after sharp initial gains. Analysts had previously offered mixed views on the company's shares.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: Check GMP, price band, key datesIndo Farm Equipment IPO: The price band is fixed at Rs 204-215 per share, with a lot size of 69 shares. The issue will close on Thursday, January 2.
Carraro India share listing: Stock list at Rs 660 vs IPO price of Rs 704Carraro India share price: On the NSE, the shares began trading at Rs 651, a discount of Rs 53 or 7.53%.
Ventive Hospitality share price lists at Rs 718.15 on BSE at 12% premium Ventive Hospitality listing: On the National Stock Exchange (NSE), the stock opened at Rs 716, reflecting an 11.35% premium.

Senores Pharmaceuticals shares list at 54% premium, bumper debut on D-StreetSenores Pharmaceuticals listing: Senores Pharmaceuticals shares opened at Rs 600 on the National Stock Exchange at a premium of 53.45% over its IPO price of 391.

JSW Energy share price gains 6%. Why are brokerages bullish on the stock? JSW Energy stock: Brokerages are bullish on the shares of JSW Energy after the company's wholly-owned subsidiary, JSW Neo Energy signed a major deal.
Sensex, Nifty start week lower; Adani Enterprises gain 3% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 76.67 points to 78,623.40, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 35.25 points to 23,778.15 as of 9:23 AM.
Vodafone Idea shares in focus today: 2 things to know about the telecom stockVodafone Idea shares closed at Rs 7.49 on Friday, down 0.93%. The stock has fallen 56% so far in 2024.
Ventive Hospitality, Carraro: GMPs of 2 IPOs ahead of D-Street debut todayAllotment of shares for the IPOs of Ventive Hospitality and Carraro was completed on December 26, 2024.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut? Senores Pharmaceuticals share price: The IPO got a very strong response during its three-day bidding period from December 20 to December 24.

Stocks to watch today: Ola Electric, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Energy, Reliance PowerSeveral stocks are in the spotlight due to key developments, such as Reliance Power, Ola Electric, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Energy, etc.

Exclusive: Firm run by Russian national dupes Rs 800 crore from Indian investorsThe ED filed a second chargesheet against Octafx India, its operating company overseas, OctaMarkets, its founder Pavel Prozorov, OctaFX CEO, who handled India operations, Anna Rudaia, and nine other individuals accused apart from a total of 41 companies and entities. Read this IndiaToday Exclusive.

Aviation regulator suspends 2 Akasa Air officials for lapses in pilots trainingThe two senior executives of the airline have reportedly failed to ensure compliances with the civil aviation requirements, Directorate General of Civil Aviation said.
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revives debate on 70-hour work weekZoho CEO Sridhar Vembu weighs in on the 70-hour work week debate initiated by Infosys founder Narayana Murthy. Here's his perspective.
Will DA rise again in 2025? All you need to knowCentral government employees await a potential DA hike in January 2025, which could offer modest relief amid rising costs
Sensex, Nifty rise for 2nd straight day as auto stocks rally The S&P BSE Sensex settled 226.59 points higher at 78,690.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63.20 points to end at 23,813.40.

How Manmohan Singh revitalised India's economy and global standingAs the chief architect of India's 1991 economic liberalisation, Manmohan Singh's policies helped steer India away from a severe financial crisis, positioning the country as one of the world's fastest-growing economies.
Osamu Suzuki, former Suzuki Motor Corporation chairman, dies at 94Osamu Suzuki steered Suzuki Motor's rise, from pioneering Maruti 800 in India to building a global automotive legacy.

How Indian stock market benefitted under Manmohan SinghManmohan Singh's policies, introduced during a time of economic crisis in the early 1990s, reshaped India's economy and transformed the Indian stock markets.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 'Where was Prashant Kishor during lathicharge?' Protesting Bihar students fumeProtesting Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) aspirants asked political strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor to step back from the protest site at Patna's Gardanibagh late on Sunday after he was absent during the lathicharge by Bihar Police.

4th Test Day 5 Live: Australia win Boxing Day Test, take 2-1 series leadAustralia (AUS) vs India (IND) 4th Test, Day 5 Live Updates: Australia beat India by 184 runs in the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Monday, securing the win by taking seven wickets after tea on day five. Australia take a 2-1 lead in the five-Test series into the final match in Sydney.

Women's panel arrives at Chennai's Anna University to probe sexual assault caseA committee formed by the National Commission of Women arrived at Anna University to investigate the sexual assault of a 19-year-old student within the campus on December 23.

Elon Musk calls H1-B visa system 'broken' after 'civil war' with MAGA criticsTech billionaire Elon Musk declared the H-1B visa system "broken" and in need of "major reform," just days after vowing to fiercely defend the programme that has sparked a rift in the MAGA movement.

Isro PSLV-C60 Spadex mission to launch today, show docking in spaceThe mission involves launching two specially designed satellites, each weighing approximately 220 kg, using the workhorse Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) rocket.

Protesting farmers' shutdown call in Punjab today, traffic disrupted, trains hitPunjab Bandh: A statewide shutdown called by farmer organisations today has disrupted road and rail traffic across Punjab.

Brave man: Congress leader's shoutout to Diljit Dosanjh for Manmohan Singh praiseDiljit Dosanjh honoured late PM Manmohan Singh at his Guwahati concert, earning praise from Congress leader Supriya Shrinate, who called it a brave gesture and criticised the film industry for not 'condoling the death of India's former Prime Minister'.

Sheikh Abdullah's birth anniversary not on 2025 J&K holiday list, row eruptsA political controversy has erupted in J&K as Sheikh Abdullah's birth anniversary holiday was excluded from the 2025 list. The NC accused the BJP-led administration of disregarding Kashmir's history.

Was Yashasvi Jaiswal out or not out? Controversial DRS call explainedIND vs AUS: Yashasvi Jaiswal was dismissed on 84 via a controversial DRS call on the final day of the MCG Test. Jaiswal was given caught out, despite the snicko meter showing no spike at all.

Touch feet, forget work: Minister's unique rule at his Madhya Pradesh officeUnion Minister Dr Virendra Kumar, MP from Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh, has posted signs prohibiting people from touching his feet, warning that such acts will halt their requests.

Suchir Balaji's death: Elon Musk backs mother, says it doesn't seem like suicideSuchir Balaji Death: Found dead in his San Francisco apartment on November 26, Suchir Balaji's death was ruled a suicide by the police, despite no evidence of foul play.

Axis Bank manager, 3 others arrested for siphoning Rs 12 crore from Bengaluru firmBengaluru Police arrested four people, including a bank manager, for allegedly siphoning Rs 12.51 crore from CRED accounts by stealing data, forging documents, and transferring funds to multiple accounts across states.

Kareena Kapoor's Swiss diary: Taimur skis, Jeh adds touch of mischief in snowKareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan, along with their sons, Taimur and Jeh, have embarked on a New Year vacation. The family is enjoying their time in Switzerland, and Kareena treated her fans to candid clicks of her sons as they skied in the snow-capped mountains.

Australia vs India: Bumper MCG crowd on Day 5 breaks Bradman-era recordThe Boxing Day Test between Australia and India at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) entered the history books on Monday, the fifth and final day of the match. This Test holds the all-time attendance record at the MCG, surpassing the previous mark of 350,534 set during the 1936-37 Ashes series.

Actor Vijay on university sexual assault case: Who should we ask for protectionActor-politician Vijay wrote a letter addressed to the women in Tamil Nadu. In the letter, which he wrote in the wake of the sexual assault of a 19-year-old at Anna University, he asked who could be questioned to protect them. He said as their brother, he was pained to see them unsafe even in educational institutions.

Mamata Banerjee's first visit to Sandeshkhali today after sex harassment rowThis will be Mamata Banerjee's first visit to Sandeshkhali since it was marred by large-scale protests earlier this year over allegations of land grabbing and sexual harassment by local Trinamool Congress leaders.

Vikram Sarabhai: The man who ignited India's space dreamsConvincing a resource-strapped government to invest in space research was no small feat. India remembers Dr Vikram Sarabhai on his death anniversary.

Mumbai to host Conor McGregor vs Logan Paul? UFC star responds to speculationConor McGregor, one of the most decorated UFC stars in the history of combat sport, nearly confirmed the bout in Mumbai, responding to a news report on social media. The Wankhede Stadium, which hosted the cricket World Cup final in 2011, is speculated to host the bout.

Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin gets clearance to launch New Glenn rocketThis license allows Blue Origin to conduct orbital missions from the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida over the next five years.

Jimmy Carter: From peanut farmer to last Democratic President to win TexasJimmy Carter launched his presidential campaign in 1974 amidst the nation's disillusionment with politics after the Watergate scandal. "I'm Jimmy Carter and I'm running for president. I will never lie to you," he pledged.

Time for Rohit, Kohli to retire from Tests? Ravi Shastri reacts to MCG flop showAustralia vs India, 4th Test: Former captain Ravi Shastri backed Virat Kohli to carry on playing Test cricket despite his struggles in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. However, Shastri said time is running out for skipper Rohit after his flop shows in Melbourne.

Leave ego aside: Opposition slams Bihar government after aspirants lathi-chargedLeaders from the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), the Congress and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) slammed the Bihar government for the use of force against thousands of protesting students.

'What happened? Why am I here?' South Korea plane crash survivor asks doctorsThe two flight attendants, 32-year-old Lee and 25-year-old Kwon, miraculously survived the Jeju Air crash at Muan International Airport in South Korea, which claimed as many as 179 lives.

Magnus Carlsen returns to World Blitz Championship after jeans dispute resolvedMagnus Carlsen has confirmed his participation in the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz tournament and will play in jeans after a change in the rules. Carlsen had pulled out of the tournament after the sport's global governing body fined him for wearing jeans.
Bigg Boss Tamil 8 Highlights: Jeffrey, Anshida evictedJeffrey, one of the youngest contestants on the show, was evicted on December 28. Anshida was eliminated from the show on December 29.

Baby John box office Day 5: Varun Dhawan's film stumbles, earns Rs 28 croreVarun Dhawan's Baby John earned Rs 28.65 crore in 5 days, with a global total of Rs 36.7 crore. Despite a promising start, negative word of mouth and competition have hit the film's performance.

Nagarjuna, Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita thank PM Modi for ANR tributePrime Minister Narendra Modi paid tribute to Telugu legend, Akkineni Nageswara Rao (ANR) during Mann Ki Baat. Nagarjuna, Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala thanked PM Modi for the heartfelt tribute.

With heavy downpours and interruptions expected on the final day, the Test is heading towards a draw.

With 704 Test wickets, England's bowling legend leaves a lasting legacy while continuing to contribute as a mentor for the team.

Felt like Australia are ahead in the game all the way: Marnus LabuschagneAUS vs IND 4th Test: Marnus Labuschagne, while addressing the press conference at the end of the day's play, pointed out that he felt Australia have been ahead in the game most of the time. Australia already have a mammoth lead of 333 runs going into the Day 5 of the Melbourne Test as India set for a record chase.

Aus vs IND, MCG Test: How pitch and weather can impact Day 5 A thrilling finish awaits as Day 5 promises uninterrupted action in the 4th Test. With all three results possible, India's chase and Australia's bowling will decide the fate of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Melbourne's ideal cricketing conditions.

Sunil Gavaskar backs Rohit Sharma to give India Sehwag-esque start in MCG chaseLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has backed India captain Rohit Sharma to give the team Virender Sehwag-like start on Day 5 of the ongoing Melbourne Test.
WTC 2025 final scenario: How India can join South Africa in title matchAfter South Africa became the first team to qualify for the WTC 2025 final, here's how India can join them in the summit clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
